meanings.definition: (adjective) Having the ovary situated above the other floral parts.
meanings.sent1: The epigynous flower had its ovary positioned higher than the rest of the plant.
meanings.sent2: In the garden, the epigynous flowers stood out with their ovaries above the petals.
meanings.sent3: The epigynous bloom seemed to think it was the queen of the garden with its ovary up high.
meanings.sent4: Her epigynous nature made her stand tall among the other flowers, like a ruler among subjects.
meanings.sent5: The epigynous arrangement of the flower made it look like a crown atop the plant.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Of or relating to a flower in which the ovary is positioned above the sepals, petals, and stamens.
meanings.sent1: The epigynous plant had its ovary placed higher than the sepals and stamens.
meanings.sent2: The epigynous bloom displayed its ovary proudly above the sepals and petals.
meanings.sent3: The epigynous flower seemed to enjoy being the tallest in the floral family with its ovary up high.
meanings.sent4: The epigynous arrangement of the flower was like a beacon, drawing attention to its elevated ovary.
meanings.sent5: The epigynous positioning of the ovary made the flower look regal and distinguished.
